page.title: 03Employment - Newmarket (2).
page.content: The National Stud: This was founded in 1915 and placed under the control of the Ministry of Agriculture. In 1963 the responsibility for the stud was transferred, by agreement, to the Horserace Betting Levy Board. A year later they acquired a 999 year lease, on behalf of the stud, on Jockey Club land next to the July Course. Very clever planning by the National Stud Director has turned this farm land into one of the greatest studs in the world. It was officially opened by the Queen in 1967. The stud now consists of 190 mare and foal stables, 20 foaling stables and 6 stallion stables. Also in the foaling unit are a small laboratory for the veterinary surgeon and a "sitting up" room for the grooms.
